snippet: The resignation of the official, the head of the group’s political office in Qatar, came amid intense debate over the appointment of the Taliban’s new commander.
abstract: Tayeb Agha, head of Taliban's diplomatic office in Qatar, publicly resigns in apparent rift over group's new leader Mullah Muhammad Omar.

byline.contributor: Taimoor Shah contributed reporting from Kandahar, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: The resignation of the official, the head of the group’s political office in Qatar, came amid intense debate over the appointment of the Taliban’s new commander.

headline.main: New Taliban Leader Faces Discord as a Top Official Quits
headline.print_headline: New Taliban Leader Faces Discord as a Top Official Quits
